intro: Pentacalia axillariflora, commonly known as the axillary-flowered pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
